page.title: 18History of Holbeach Hurn.
page.content: It is thought that the village dates from about 1195.There is much evidence of the existance of salterns in the village, and probably they date from before this.At this date Thorney Abbey was given 1\acres of land for a saltern at Hirneflete by "Conan son of Ellis".It is thought that the present Hurn Hall was the site of Conan's house.By 1849 the village was a thriving community with a butcher,2 shopkeepers,a baker and flour dealer,2 blacksmiths,a beer retailer,and 2 publicans,3 farmers and a horsebreaker.The big event of the village used to be the annual outing.One year 11 busloads of children parents and friends went off for the day leaving only one villager to enjoy the peace.This has now ceased but the village hall committee runs a Christmas party and trip for children.
